statements: UPDATE tutorials SET tutorial_title = 'Updated Title', tutorial_description = 'Updated Description' WHERE tutorial_id = 1;
UPDATE tutorials SET created_date = '2022-01-01', tutorial_title = 'New Title' WHERE tutorial_id = 2;
UPDATE tutorials SET tutorial_title='Advanced SQL Techniques', tutorial_description='In-depth guide on SQL optimizations' WHERE tutorial_id=1;
UPDATE tutorials SET created_date='2022-08-15', tutorial_title='Data Visualization in SQL' WHERE tutorial_id=3;
UPDATE students SET email='john.doe@example.com', name='John Doe' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE queries SET executed=true, query_text='SELECT * FROM students;' WHERE student_id=1;
UPDATE students SET email='example1@gmail.com' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE queries SET executed=true, query_text='New complex query' WHERE student_id=2;
UPDATE student SET email = 'johndoe@email.com' WHERE id = 1;
UPDATE tutorial SET difficulty_level = 'Intermediate' WHERE tutorial_id = 2;
UPDATE student SET name='John Doe', email='john.doe@example.com' WHERE id=1;
UPDATE tutorial SET difficulty_level='Intermediate', tutorial_name='Advanced SQL Queries' WHERE tutorial_id=5;
UPDATE students SET age = 20 WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE tutorials SET author = 'John Doe' WHERE tutorial_id = 3;
UPDATE students SET age = 25, name = 'John Doe' WHERE student_id = 101;
UPDATE queries SET rating = 4.5, tutorial_id = 201 WHERE query_id = 301;
UPDATE TutorialStats SET completion_status = TRUE WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE TutorialProgress SET progress_percentage = 75 WHERE student_id = 2 AND tutorial_id = 3;
UPDATE TutorialStats SET completion_status = FALSE WHERE student_id = 1;
UPDATE Students SET email = 'newemail@example.com' WHERE student_id = 2;
